qas.question: Who did many of Universal-International's Arabian Nights films feature?
Who notably produced monster and science fiction films for Universal?
What Universal director was known for his melodramas?
Who directed monster movies for Universal?
What series of films did Tony Alland star in?
What types of films did William Curtis produce?
What type of films did Douglas Hunter and Ross Sirk produce?
What company did stars Rock Hudson, Tony Chandler, and Jeff Curtis work for?

context: In the 1950s, Universal-International resumed their series of <b5_0>Arabian Nights<b5_0/> films, many starring <a0_0>Tony Curtis<a0_0/>. The studio also had a success with <b6_0>monster and science fiction<b6_0/> films produced by <a1_0>William Alland<a1_0/>, with many directed by <a3_0>Jack Arnold<a3_0/>. Other successes were the <b7_0>melodramas<b7_0/> directed by <a2_0>Douglas Sirk<a2_0/> and produced by <a4_0>Ross Hunter<a4_0/>, although for film critics they were not so well thought of on first release as they have since become. Among <b8_0>Universal-International<b8_0/>'s stable of stars were Rock Hudson, Tony Curtis, Jeff Chandler, Audie Murphy, and John Gavin.
